The Grand Tournament.text: Hero Power Summon a Totem of your choice.
The Grand Tournament.name: Totemic Slam
Undercity Valiant
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Almost went to play for Stormwind before signing with Undercity.

The Grand Tournament.name: Wrathguard
The Grand Tournament.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, also deal that amount to your hero.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: After playing against 5 Annoy-O-Trons, any normal guard will become a Wrathguard.

The Grand Tournament.name: Wyrmrest Agent
The Grand Tournament.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Taunt.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Keeping tabs on the Grand Tournament is priority #1 for the five mighty Dragonflights!

The Grand Tournament.name: Argent Horserider
The Grand Tournament.flavor: His horse's name is Betsy.

The Grand Tournament.name: Bash
The Grand Tournament.flavor: You might think bashing doesn't take a lot of practice.  It doesn't.

The Grand Tournament.name: Beneath the Grounds
The Grand Tournament.text: Shuffle 3 Ambushes into your opponent's deck. When drawn, you summon a 4/4 Nerubian.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Can you hold these eggs for just a second?  I promise they're not full of giant enraged undead spider things.

The Grand Tournament.name: Burgle
The Grand Tournament.text: Add 2 random class cards to your hand (from your opponent's class).
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Yoink!

The Grand Tournament.name: Coliseum Manager
The Grand Tournament.text: Inspire: Return this minion to your hand.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Meets monthly with the gladiators to discuss career goals.

The Grand Tournament.name: Dragonhawk Rider
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Check it out.  You can do barrel rolls on this thing.

The Grand Tournament.name: Dreadscale
The Grand Tournament.text: At the end of your turn, deal 1 damage to all other minions.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Let's be clear about this:  ACIDMAW is the sidekick.

The Grand Tournament.name: Effigy
The Grand Tournament.text: Secret: When a friendly minion dies, summon a random minion with the same Cost.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Burning man, brah.

The Grand Tournament.name: Elemental Destruction
The Grand Tournament.flavor: I'm not a shaman or anything, but isn't Elemental Destruction the opposite of what they want to do?

The Grand Tournament.name: Eydis Darkbane
The Grand Tournament.text: Whenever you target this minion with a spell, deal 3 damage to a random enemy.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: HATES being called "the wonder twins".

The Grand Tournament.name: Fencing Coach
The Grand Tournament.text: Battlecry: The next time you use your Hero Power, it costs (2) less.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Good fencers make good neighbors, right?

The Grand Tournament.name: Fjola Lightbane
The Grand Tournament.text: Whenever you target this minion with a spell, gain Divine Shield.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: LOVES being called "the wonder twins".

The Grand Tournament.name: Healing Wave
The Grand Tournament.text: Restore #7 Health. Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, Restore #14 instead.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Favored by shaman who study the art of restoration and healing, this spell would feel smug, if it had feelings.

The Grand Tournament.name: Ice Rager
The Grand Tournament.flavor: He's a lot cooler than Magma Rager.

The Grand Tournament.name: King's Defender
The Grand Tournament.text: Battlecry: If you have a minion with Taunt, gain +1 Durability.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: "King's Attacker" is a shield.  Funny, huh?

The Grand Tournament.name: Light's Champion
The Grand Tournament.flavor: When there's something strange (say, a gibbering demon) in your neighborhood, who are you going to call?

The Grand Tournament.name: Master of Ceremonies
The Grand Tournament.text: Battlecry: If you have a minion with Spell Damage, gain +2/+2.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Goes by "MC ElfyElf".

The Grand Tournament.name: Mulch
The Grand Tournament.text:
Destroy a minion.
Add a random minion to your opponent's hand.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Is this a noun or a verb?  We will never know.

The Grand Tournament.name: Orgrimmar Aspirant
The Grand Tournament.flavor: "Four out of three orcs struggle with math." - Angry Zurge

The Grand Tournament.name: Polymorph: Boar
The Grand Tournament.text: Transform a minion into a 4/2 Boar with Charge.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: It's always Huffer.

The Grand Tournament.name: Powershot
The Grand Tournament.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion and the minions next to it.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: pow POW pow

The Grand Tournament.name: Saboteur
The Grand Tournament.text: Battlecry: Your opponent's Hero Power costs (5) more next turn.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Listen all y'all it's a saboteur!

The Grand Tournament.name: Seal of Champions
The Grand Tournament.text: Give a minion +3 Attack and Divine Shield.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: "Arf! Arf! Arf!" - Seal of Champions

The Grand Tournament.name: Shadowfiend
The Grand Tournament.text: Whenever you draw a card, reduce its Cost by (1).
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Hopes to be promoted to "Shadowfriend" someday.

The Grand Tournament.name: Shady Dealer
The Grand Tournament.text: Battlecry: If you have a Pirate, gain +1/+1.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: I have great deal for you... for 4 damage to your face!

The Grand Tournament.name: Silent Knight
The Grand Tournament.flavor: He used to be a librarian.  Old habits die hard.

The Grand Tournament.name: Silver Hand Regent
The Grand Tournament.flavor: The Silver Hand is the best paladin organization.  The Argent Crusaders are super jealous.

The Grand Tournament.name: Spellslinger
The Grand Tournament.text: Battlecry: Add a random spell to each player's hand.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Does he sling spells, or do his spells linger about.  Who can say?

The Grand Tournament.name: Stablemaster
The Grand Tournament.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly Beast Immune this turn.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Takes way better care of her pets than her brother, Unstablemaster.

The Grand Tournament.name: Tuskarr Totemic
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Turns out the tuskarr aren't real choosy about their totems.

The Grand Tournament.name: Warhorse Trainer
The Grand Tournament.text: Your Silver Hand Recruits have +1 Attack.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: He doesn't even get Sundays off.  Every day he's hostling.

The Grand Tournament.name: Armored Warhorse
The Grand Tournament.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, gain Charge.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Yep.  It's a horse... wearing armor... going to war.

The Grand Tournament.name: Astral Communion
The Grand Tournament.text: Gain 10 Mana Crystals. Discard your hand.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Hey!  Moon!  Can I have some mana crystals?

The Grand Tournament.name: Charged Hammer
The Grand Tournament.flavor: You can only pick it up if you are worthy.

The Grand Tournament.name: Crowd Favorite
The Grand Tournament.text: Whenever you play a card with Battlecry, gain +1/+1.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: The crowd ALWAYS yells lethal.

The Grand Tournament.name: Dalaran Aspirant
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Is he aspiring or inspiring?  Make up your mind!

The Grand Tournament.name: Draenei Totemcarver
The Grand Tournament.flavor: It's nice to find a real craftsman in this day and age of mass-produced totems.

The Grand Tournament.name: Dreadsteed
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Crescendo himself summoned this steed, riding it to victory in the Grand Tournament.  Wherever he rides, an army of riders ride behind him, supporting the legendary champion.

The Grand Tournament.name: Evil Heckler
The Grand Tournament.flavor: To be honest, heckling is not the most effective form of evil.

The Grand Tournament.name: Fist of Jaraxxus
The Grand Tournament.text: When you play or discard this, deal $4 damage to a random enemy.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: * Not actually Jaraxxus' fist.

The Grand Tournament.name: Frigid Snobold
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Ironically, the natural enemy of the snobold is THE CANDLE.

The Grand Tournament.name: Gormok the Impaler
The Grand Tournament.text: Battlecry: If you have at least 4 other minions, deal 4 damage.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Gormok has been giving impaling lessons in a small tent near the tournament grounds.  For only 25g you too could learn the fine art of impaling!

The Grand Tournament.name: Holy Champion
The Grand Tournament.text: Whenever a character is healed, gain +2 Attack.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: She really likes seeing people get better.  That's why she hurts them in the first place.

The Grand Tournament.name: Magnataur Alpha
The Grand Tournament.text:
Also damages the minions next to whomever
he attacks.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Playing him also gets you into the Magnataur Beta.

The Grand Tournament.name: Maiden of the Lake
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Not a good basis for a system of government.

The Grand Tournament.name: Murloc Knight
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Hee hee!  Look at his cute little feet.

The Grand Tournament.name: Poisoned Blade
The Grand Tournament.text: Your Hero Power gives this weapon +1 Attack instead of replacing it.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: How much more poisoned can a blade get?  The answer is a lot.  A lot more poisoned.

The Grand Tournament.name: Refreshment Vendor
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Menu:  Funnel cakes, carrots, popcorn, jormungar steaks.  It's hard serving a diverse clientele.

The Grand Tournament.name: Savage Combatant
The Grand Tournament.text: Inspire: Give your hero +2 Attack this turn.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Maybe if you whistle a tune it will soothe him.  Yeah...  Try that.

The Grand Tournament.name: Spawn of Shadows
The Grand Tournament.flavor: What did you expect to happen?  He's a Spawn.  Of Shadows.

The Grand Tournament.name: Tournament Medic
The Grand Tournament.flavor: The medic tournament is less entertaining than the Grand Tournament.

The Grand Tournament.name: Twilight Guardian
The Grand Tournament.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Taunt.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: A result of magical experiments carried out by the Black Dragonflight, it's not his fault that he's a vicious killer.

The Grand Tournament.name: Wildwalker
The Grand Tournament.flavor: She was born to be something.  She is just not quite sure what yet...

The Grand Tournament.name: Clockwork Knight
The Grand Tournament.flavor: It takes a lot to wind him up.

The Grand Tournament.name: Flame Lance
The Grand Tournament.flavor: It's on the rack next to ice lance, acid lance, and English muffin lance.

The Grand Tournament.name: Kvaldir Raider
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Coming soon... to a tuskarr village near you!

The Grand Tournament.name: Mukla's Champion
The Grand Tournament.flavor: An elegant gorilla, for a more civilized age.

The Grand Tournament.name: Nexus-Champion Saraad
The Grand Tournament.text: Inspire: Add a random spell to your hand.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: The ethereals have their own jousting tournament, and Saraad is the reigning champion.  Also he won the ethereal hot dog eating contest.

The Grand Tournament.name: Pit Fighter
The Grand Tournament.flavor: What did the pits ever do to you?

The Grand Tournament.name: Ram Wrangler
The Grand Tournament.text: Battlecry: If you have a Beast, summon a random Beast.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Not getting trampled is really the trick here.

The Grand Tournament.name: Recruiter
The Grand Tournament.text: Inspire: Add a 2/2 Squire to your hand.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Join the Argent Crusade!  We have attractive tabards and you get to carry really nice swords!

The Grand Tournament.name: Shado-Pan Rider
The Grand Tournament.flavor: He needed a break after that business in the Vale of Eternal Blossoms. Naturally, he chose to spend his vacation in an icy snowscape killing monsters.

The Grand Tournament.name: Thunder Bluff Valiant
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Allowing totems to attack is not cheating.  I mean, there isn't anything in the rule books about it.

The Grand Tournament.name: Tuskarr Jouster
The Grand Tournament.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, restore 7 Health to your hero.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Just could not be talked out of using his turtle for the joust...

The Grand Tournament.name: Ball of Spiders
The Grand Tournament.flavor: "THEY'RE EVERYWHERE GET THEM OFF!!!" - Everyone

The Grand Tournament.name: Bolf Ramshield
The Grand Tournament.text: Whenever your hero takes damage, this minion takes it instead.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Bolf keeps coming in 2nd at the Grand Tournament.  It might be his year this year, if Lebron doesn't enter.

The Grand Tournament.name: Coldarra Drake
The Grand Tournament.text: You can use your Hero Power any number of times.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: The Grand Tournament has a "No dragons allowed" policy, but it's rarely enforced.

The Grand Tournament.name: Dark Bargain
The Grand Tournament.text: Destroy 2 random enemy minions. Discard 2 random cards.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: A prime example of lose-lose negotiating.

The Grand Tournament.name: Enter the Coliseum
The Grand Tournament.text: Destroy all minions except each player's highest Attack minion.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: You have to get past the vendors first.  So many are lost to shopping...

The Grand Tournament.name: Grand Crusader
The Grand Tournament.text: Battlecry: Add a random Paladin card to your hand.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: A veteran of a number of crusades, she is a force for light and goodness.  Her latest crusade is against goblin telemarketers.

The Grand Tournament.name: Justicar Trueheart
The Grand Tournament.text: Battlecry: Replace your starting Hero Power with a better one.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: It's like putting racing stripes and a giant spoiler on your hero power.

The Grand Tournament.name: Kodorider
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Someone called her a Rhinorider, and she's NOT HAPPY.

The Grand Tournament.name: Master Jouster
The Grand Tournament.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, gain Taunt and Divine Shield.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Needs just a few more ratings points to become Grandmaster Jouster.

The Grand Tournament.name: Mogor's Champion
The Grand Tournament.text: 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: This champion has learned from the best.  Except for his target selection.

The Grand Tournament.name: Mysterious Challenger
The Grand Tournament.text: Battlecry: Put one of each Secret from your deck into the battlefield.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: He may sound surly and antisocial, but he's actually just really shy.

The Grand Tournament.name: Sea Reaver
The Grand Tournament.text: When you draw this, deal 1 damage to your minions.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: A little better than Sea Minus Reaver.

The Grand Tournament.name: Sideshow Spelleater
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Hey!  Let me try that...

The Grand Tournament.name: The Mistcaller
The Grand Tournament.text: Battlecry: Give all minions in your hand and deck +1/+1.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Calling the mist doesn't sound all that great.  "Ooooh, it is slightly damp now!"

The Grand Tournament.name: The Skeleton Knight
The Grand Tournament.text: Deathrattle: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, return this to your hand.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Apparently it really was just a flesh wound.

The Grand Tournament.name: Void Crusher
The Grand Tournament.text: Inspire: Destroy a random minion for each player.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: We like to call him "Wesley".

The Grand Tournament.name: Wilfred Fizzlebang
The Grand Tournament.text: Cards you draw from your Hero Power cost (0).
The Grand Tournament.flavor:
He can summon anything, even a FEARSOME DOOMGUARD*.

*He's pretty sure this is going to work out.

The Grand Tournament.name: Acidmaw
The Grand Tournament.text: Whenever another minion takes damage, destroy it.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: With the help of his trusty sidekick Dreadscale, the giant jormungar Acidmaw is ready to face any knight!

The Grand Tournament.name: Captured Jormungar
The Grand Tournament.flavor: You can keep him, but you have to promise to feed him and clean out his tank every day!

The Grand Tournament.name: Chillmaw
The Grand Tournament.text: Taunt Deathrattle: If you're holding a Dragon, deal 3 damage to all minions.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Chillmaw keeps trying to ruin the Grand Tournament, and she would've done it too, if it weren't for those dang kids!

The Grand Tournament.name: Confessor Paletress
The Grand Tournament.flavor: She sees into your past and makes you face your fears.  Most common fear:  Getting Majordomo out of Sneed's Old Shredder.

The Grand Tournament.name: Eadric the Pure
The Grand Tournament.text: Battlecry: Change all enemy minions' Attack to 1.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Nobody rocks a monocle like Eadric.

The Grand Tournament.name: Fearsome Doomguard
The Grand Tournament.flavor: They were originally called Cuddleguards, but they were not inspiring the proper amount of fear.

The Grand Tournament.name: Knight of the Wild
The Grand Tournament.text: Whenever you summon a Beast, reduce the Cost of this card by (1).
The Grand Tournament.flavor: He gets a discount on the tournament entry fee because he is his own horse.

The Grand Tournament.name: Skycap'n Kragg
The Grand Tournament.text: Charrrrrge Costs (1) less for each friendly Pirate.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: What's more boss than riding a parrot with a jawbone for a shoulderpad while wielding a giant hook-lance-thing and wearing a pirate hat?  NOTHING.

The Grand Tournament.name: Rhonin
The Grand Tournament.text: Deathrattle: Add 3 copies of Arcane Missiles to your hand.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: A masterless shamurai.

The Grand Tournament.name: Anub'arak
The Grand Tournament.text: Deathrattle: Return this to your hand and summon a 4/4 Nerubian.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Was actually a pretty nice guy before, you know, the whole Lich King thing.

The Grand Tournament.name: Aviana
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Call her "Tweety".  She'll find it real funny.  I PROMISE.

The Grand Tournament.name: Icehowl
The Grand Tournament.flavor: This massive yeti just closes his eyes and charges at the nearest target.  The nearest Target is a couple blocks away and has sick deals on skateboards.

The Grand Tournament.name: North Sea Kraken
The Grand Tournament.flavor: You have no idea how tired this guy is of being released.

The Grand Tournament.name: Frost Giant
The Grand Tournament.text: Costs (1) less for each time you used your Hero Power this game.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Don't ask him about the beard.  JUST DON'T.

The Grand Tournament.name: Varian Wrynn
The Grand Tournament.text: Battlecry: Draw 3 cards. Put any minions you drew directly into the battlefield.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Leader of the Alliance!  Father of Anduin!  Also he likes to play Arena, and he averages 12 wins.

Basic.text: Warsong Commander is granting this minion +1 Attack.
Basic.name: Charge

Basic.text: Your hero has +1 Attack this turn.
Basic.name: Claws

Basic.text: Going second makes your first minion stronger.
Basic.name: Coin's Vengeance

Basic.text: Going second makes your first minion stronger.
Basic.name: Coin's Vengence

Basic.text: At the start of the corrupting player's turn, destroy this minion.
Basic.name: Corruption

Basic.text: Raid Leader is granting this minion +1 Attack.
Basic.name: Enhanced

Basic.text: Leokk is granting this minion +1 Attack.
Basic.name: Eye In The Sky

Basic.text: This Beast has +1 Attack from Timber Wolf.
Basic.name: Furious Howl

Basic.text: Going second grants you increased Health.
Basic.name: Luck of the Coin

Basic.text: This minion has been transformed into a 1/1 Sheep.
Basic.name: Polymorph

Basic.text: This character has +3 Attack this turn.
Basic.name: Rockbiter Weapon

Basic.text: Gain 1 Mana Crystal this turn only.
Basic.name: The Coin
Ancestral Healing
Basic.text: Restore a minion to full Health and give it Taunt.
Basic.flavor: I personally prefer some non-ancestral right-the-heck-now healing, but maybe that is just me.

Basic.name: Avatar of the Coin
Basic.text: You lost the coin flip, but gained a friend.

Basic.name: Backstab
Basic.text: Deal $2 damage to an undamaged minion.
Basic.flavor: It's funny how often yelling "Look over there!" gets your opponent to turn around.

Basic.text: Draw a card. (You can only have 10 Mana in your tray.)
Basic.name: Excess Mana
Innervate
Basic.text: Gain 2 Mana Crystals this turn only.
Basic.flavor: Some druids still have flashbacks from strangers yelling "Innervate me!!" at them.

Basic.name: Moonfire
Basic.flavor: "Cast Moonfire, and never stop." - How to Be a Druid, Chapter 5, Section 3

Basic.name: Sacrificial Pact
Basic.text: Destroy a Demon. Restore #5 Health to your hero.
Basic.flavor: This is the reason that Demons never really become friends with Warlocks.

Basic.name: Totemic Might
Basic.flavor: Totem-stomping is no longer recommended.

Basic.name: Arcane Missiles
Basic.text: Deal $3 damage randomly split among all enemies.
Basic.flavor: You'd think you'd be able to control your missiles a little better since you're a powerful mage and all.

Basic.name: Arcane Shot
Basic.flavor: Magi conjured arcane arrows to sell to hunters, until hunters learned just enough magic to do it themselves.  The resulting loss of jobs sent Stormwind into a minor recession.

Basic.name: Blessing of Might
Basic.flavor: "As in, you MIGHT want to get out of my way." - Toad Mackle, recently buffed.

Basic.name: Claw
Basic.text: Give your hero +2 Attack this turn and 2 Armor.
Basic.flavor: The claw decides who will stay and who will go.

Basic.name: Corruption
Basic.text: Choose an enemy minion. At the start of your turn, destroy it.
Basic.flavor: It starts with stealing a pen from work, and before you know it, BOOM!  Corrupted!

Basic.name: Deadly Poison
Basic.flavor: Rogues guard the secrets to poison-making carefully, lest magi start incorporating poison into their spells.  Poisonbolt? Rain of Poison?  Poison Elemental?  Nobody wants that.

Basic.name: Elven Archer
Basic.flavor: Don't bother asking her out on a date.  She'll shoot you down.

Basic.name: Execute
Basic.flavor: It's okay, he deserved it.

Basic.name: Frost Shock
Basic.text: Deal $1 damage to an enemy character and Freeze it.
Basic.flavor: FROST SHOCK!

Basic.name: Goldshire Footman
Basic.flavor: If 1/2 minions are all that is defending Goldshire, you would think it would have been overrun years ago.

Basic.name: Grimscale Oracle
Basic.flavor: These are the brainy murlocs.  It turns out that doesn’t mean much.

Basic.name: Hand of Protection
Basic.flavor: This spell has been renamed so many times, even paladins don’t know what it should be called anymore.

Basic.name: Healing Totem
Basic.text: At the end of your turn, restore 1 Health to all friendly minions.

Basic.name: Holy Smite
Basic.flavor: It doesn't matter how pious you are.  Everyone needs a good smiting now and again.

Basic.name: Humility
Basic.flavor: This card makes something really damp.  Oh wait.  That's "Humidity."

Basic.name: Hunter's Mark
Basic.flavor: Never play 'Hide and Go Seek' with a Hunter.

Basic.name: Light's Justice
Basic.flavor: Prince Malchezaar was a collector of rare weapons. He'd animate them and have them dance for him.

Basic.name: Mind Vision
Basic.text: Put a copy of a random card in your opponent's hand into your hand.
Basic.flavor: I see what you did there.

Basic.name: Mirror Image
Basic.flavor: Oh hey it's Mirror Image! !egamI rorriM s'ti yeh hO

Basic.name: Mortal Coil
Basic.text: Deal $1 damage to a minion. If that kills it, draw a card.
Basic.flavor: If your spells look like horrifying skulls, let's be honest, you should get to draw some cards.

Basic.name: Murloc Raider
Basic.flavor: Mrrraggglhlhghghlgh, mrgaaag blarrghlgaahahl mrgggg glhalhah a bghhll graggmgmg Garrosh mglhlhlh mrghlhlhl!!

Basic.name: Northshire Cleric
Basic.text: Whenever a minion is healed, draw a card.
Basic.flavor: They help the downtrodden and distressed.  Also they sell cookies.

Basic.name: Power Word: Shield
Basic.text:
Give a minion +2 Health.
Draw a card.
Basic.flavor: Sure the extra protection is nice, but the shield really reduces visibility.

Basic.name: Rockbiter Weapon
Basic.text: Give a friendly character +3 Attack this turn.
Basic.flavor: This would be real handy if your enemy is made of rock.

Basic.name: Sinister Strike
Basic.text: Deal $3 damage to the enemy hero.
Basic.flavor: There's something about this strike that just feels off.  Sinister, even.

Basic.name: Soulfire
Basic.text: Deal $4 damage. Discard a random card.
Basic.flavor: Are you lighting a soul on fire? Or burning someone with your OWN soul? This seems like an important distinction.

Basic.name: Stonetusk Boar
Basic.flavor: This card is boaring.

Basic.name: Timber Wolf
Basic.flavor: Other beasts totally dig hanging out with timber wolves.

Basic.name: Tracking
Basic.text: Look at the top three cards of your deck. Draw one and discard the others.
Basic.flavor: For the person who just cannot decide what card to put into a deck!

Basic.name: Voidwalker
Basic.flavor: No relation to "The Voidsteppers", the popular Void-based dance troupe.

Basic.name: Voodoo Doctor
Basic.flavor: Voodoo is an oft-misunderstood art. But it is art.

Basic.name: Whirlwind
Basic.flavor: The way to tell seasoned warriors from novice ones: the novices yell "wheeeee" while whirlwinding.

Basic.name: Acidic Swamp Ooze
Basic.flavor: Oozes love Flamenco.  Don't ask.

Basic.name: Arcane Explosion
Basic.text: Deal $1 damage to all enemy minions.
Basic.flavor: This spell is much better than Arcane Implosion.

Basic.name: Bloodfen Raptor
Basic.flavor: "Kill 30 raptors." - Hemet Nesingwary

Basic.name: Bluegill Warrior
Basic.flavor: He just wants a hug.   A sloppy... slimy... hug.

Basic.name: Cleave
Basic.text: Deal $2 damage to two random enemy minions.
Basic.flavor: Hey you two…could you stand next to each other for a second…

Basic.name: Divine Spirit
Basic.flavor: Double the trouble. Double the fun!

Basic.name: Fiery War Axe
Basic.flavor: During times of tranquility and harmony, this weapon was called by its less popular name, Chilly Peace Axe.

Basic.name: Flametongue Totem
Basic.flavor: Totemsmiths like to use the rarest woods for their totems.  There are even rumors of totems made of Ironbark Protectors.

Basic.name: Frostbolt
Basic.text: Deal $3 damage to a character and Freeze it.
Basic.flavor: It is customary to yell "Chill out!" or "Freeze!" or "Ice ice, baby!" when you play this card.

Basic.name: Frostwolf Grunt
Basic.flavor: Grunting is what his father did and his father before that.   It's more than just a job.

Basic.name: Heroic Strike
Basic.text: Give your hero +4 Attack this turn.
Basic.flavor: Really, if you're a hero, this is every strike.

Basic.name: Holy Light
Basic.flavor: If you are often bathed in Holy Light, you should consider wearing sunscreen.

Basic.name: Kobold Geomancer
Basic.flavor: In the old days, Kobolds were the finest candle merchants in the land. Then they got pushed too far...

Basic.name: Life Tap
Basic.text: Hero Power Draw a card and take $2 damage.

Basic.name: Mark of the Wild
Basic.text: Give a minion Taunt and +2/+2. (+2 Attack/+2 Health)
Basic.flavor: Not to be confused with Jim of the Wild.

Basic.name: Mind Blast
Basic.text: Deal $5 damage to the enemy hero.
Basic.flavor: This spell blasts you directly in the MIND.

Basic.name: Murloc Tidehunter
Basic.flavor: "Death will rise, from the tides!"
Even your flavor text has been deleted. Dang.
Basic.text: Somehow, the card you USED to have has been deleted.  Here, have this one instead!
Basic.name: NOOOOOOOOOOOO
Novice Engineer
Basic.flavor: "Half of this class will not graduate… since they'll have been turned to chickens." - Tinkmaster Overspark, teaching Gizmos 101.

Basic.name: Reinforce
Basic.text: Hero Power Summon a 1/1 Silver Hand Recruit.

Basic.name: River Crocolisk
Basic.flavor: Edward "Lefty" Smith tried to make luggage out of a river crocolisk once.

Basic.name: Sap
Basic.text: Return an enemy minion to your opponent's hand.
Basic.flavor: Rogues love sappy movies.

Basic.name: Shadow Word: Pain
Basic.text: Destroy a minion with 3 or less Attack.
Basic.flavor: A step up from a spell cast by many beginning acolytes: "Shadow Word: Annoy".

Basic.name: Shiv
Basic.flavor: Rogues are experts at SHIV-al-ry.

Basic.name: Steady Shot
Basic.text: Hero Power Deal $2 damage to the enemy hero.

Basic.name: Succubus
Basic.flavor: Warlocks have it pretty good.

Basic.name: Wild Growth
Basic.flavor: Grow your own mana crystals with this Mana Crystal Growth Kit, only 39.99!

Basic.name: Windfury
Basic.flavor: Windfury is like Earthfury and Firefury, but more light and airy.

Basic.name: Animal Companion
Basic.flavor: You could summon Misha, Leokk, or Huffer!  Huffer is more trouble than he's worth.

Basic.name: Arcane Intellect
Basic.flavor: Playing this card makes you SMARTER.  And let's face it: we could all stand to be a little smarter.

Basic.name: Charge
Basic.text: Give a friendly minion +2 Attack and Charge.
Basic.flavor: "Guys! Guys! Slow down!" - some kind of non-warrior minion

Basic.name: Dalaran Mage
Basic.flavor: You don't see a lot of Dalaran warriors.

Basic.name: Drain Life
Basic.text: Deal $2 damage. Restore #2 Health to your hero.
Basic.flavor: "I've just sucked one year of your life away."

Basic.name: Fan of Knives
Basic.text: Deal $1 damage to all enemy minions. Draw a card.
Basic.flavor: I wouldn't say I LOVE knives, but I'm definitely a fan.

Basic.name: Frost Nova
Basic.flavor: Hey man, that's cold.  Literally and metaphorically.

Basic.name: Healing Touch
Basic.flavor: 8 Health, no waiting.

Basic.name: Hex
Basic.text: Transform a minion into a 0/1 Frog with Taunt.
Basic.flavor: If you Hex a Murloc... it really isn't much of a change, is it?

Basic.name: Ironforge Rifleman
Basic.flavor: "Ready! Aim! Drink!"

Basic.name: Ironfur Grizzly
Basic.flavor: "Bear Carcass 1/10"

Basic.name: Kill Command
Basic.text: Deal $3 damage. If you have a Beast, deal $5 damage instead.
Basic.flavor: "Kill!", he commanded.

Basic.name: Magma Rager
Basic.flavor: He likes to think he is powerful, but pretty much anyone can solo Molten Core now.

Basic.name: Raid Leader
Basic.flavor: "That's a 50 DKP minus!"

Basic.name: Razorfen Hunter
Basic.flavor: Someone did mess with Tuskerr once.  ONCE.

Basic.name: Savage Roar
Basic.text: Give your characters +2 Attack this turn.
Basic.flavor: What do they roar? Nobody can quite tell, but it sounds like "Elephant Macho Breeze".  It's probably not that, though.

Basic.name: Shadow Bolt
Basic.flavor: It’s a Bolt.   It's made out of Shadow.   What more do you need to know!

Basic.name: Shadow Word: Death
Basic.text: Destroy a minion with an Attack of 5 or more.
Basic.flavor: If you miss, it leaves a lightning-bolt-shaped scar on your target.

Basic.name: Shattered Sun Cleric
Basic.flavor: They always have a spare flask of Sunwell Energy Drink™!

Basic.name: Shield Block
Basic.flavor: Shields were invented because Face Block is USELESS.

Basic.name: Silverback Patriarch
Basic.flavor: He likes to act like he's in charge, but the silverback matriarch actually runs things.

Basic.name: Warsong Commander
Basic.flavor: The Warsong clan is such drama. It's really not worth it to become a commander.

Basic.name: Wolfrider
Basic.flavor: Orcish raiders ride wolves because they are well adapted to harsh environments, and because they are soft and cuddly.

Basic.name: Blessing of Kings
Basic.flavor: Given the number of kings who have been assassinated, are you sure you want their blessing?

Basic.name: Chillwind Yeti
Basic.flavor: He always dreamed of coming down from the mountains and opening a noodle shop, but he never got the nerve.

Basic.name: Consecration
Basic.flavor: Consecrated ground glows with Holy energy.  But it smells a little, too.

Basic.name: Dragonling Mechanic
Basic.flavor: She is still working on installing the rocket launcher add-on for Mr. Bitey.

Basic.name: Fireball
Basic.flavor: This spell is useful for burning things.  If you're looking for spells that toast things, or just warm them a little, you're in the wrong place.

Basic.name: Gnomish Inventor
Basic.flavor: She's never quite sure what she's making, she just knows it's AWESOME!

Basic.name: Hammer of Wrath
Basic.flavor: A good paladin has many tools.  Hammer of Wrath, Pliers of Vengeance, Hacksaw of Justice, etc.

Basic.name: Hellfire
Basic.flavor: It's spells like these that make it hard for Warlocks to get decent help.

Basic.name: Houndmaster
Basic.flavor: "Who let the dogs out?" he asks.  It's rhetorical.

Basic.name: Kor'kron Elite
Basic.flavor: The Kor'kron are the elite forces of Garrosh Hellscream. Let's just say you don't want to run into these guys while wearing a blue tabard.

Basic.name: Multi-Shot
Basic.text: Deal $3 damage to two random enemy minions.
Basic.flavor: You see, it's all about throughput.

Basic.name: Oasis Snapjaw
Basic.flavor: His dreams of flying and breathing fire like his idol will never be realized.

Basic.name: Ogre Magi
Basic.flavor: Training Ogres in the art of spellcasting is a questionable decision.

Basic.name: Polymorph
Basic.text: Transform a minion into a 1/1 Sheep.
Basic.flavor: There was going to be a pun in this flavor text, but it just came out baa-d.

Basic.name: Sen'jin Shieldmasta
Basic.flavor: Sen'jin Villiage is nice, if you like trolls and dust.

Basic.name: Stormwind Knight
Basic.flavor: They're still embarassed about "The Deathwing Incident".

Basic.name: Swipe
Basic.text: Deal $4 damage to an enemy and $1 damage to all other enemies.
Basic.flavor: When a bear rears back and extends his arms, he's about to Swipe!  ... or hug.

Basic.name: Truesilver Champion
Basic.text: Whenever your hero attacks, restore 2 Health to it.
Basic.flavor: It Slices, it Dices. You can cut a tin can with it. (But you wouldn't want to.)

Basic.name: Water Elemental
Basic.text: Freeze any character damaged by this minion.
Basic.flavor: Don't summon a water elemental at a party.  It'll dampen the mood.

Basic.name: Windspeaker
Basic.flavor: Is there anything worse than a Windspeaker with halitosis?

Basic.name: Arcanite Reaper
Basic.flavor: No… actually you should fear the Reaper.

Basic.name: Assassin's Blade
Basic.flavor: Guaranteed to have been owned by a real assassin.   Certificate of authenticity included.

Basic.name: Assassinate
Basic.flavor: If you don't want to be assassinated, move to the Barrens and change your name. Good luck!

Basic.name: Bloodlust
Basic.text: Give your minions +3 Attack this turn.
Basic.flavor: blaarghghLLGHRHARAAHAHHH!!

Basic.name: Booty Bay Bodyguard
Basic.flavor: You can hire him... until someone offers him enough gold to turn on you.

Basic.name: Darkscale Healer
Basic.text: Battlecry: Restore 2 Health to all friendly characters.
Basic.flavor: Healing is just something she does in her free time.  It's more of a hobby really.

Basic.name: Frostwolf Warlord
Basic.text: Battlecry: Gain +1/+1 for each other friendly minion on the battlefield.
Basic.flavor: The Frostwolves are locked in combat with the Stormpike Expedition over control of Alterac Valley.  Every attempt at peace-talks has ended with Captain Galvangar killing the mediator.

Basic.name: Gurubashi Berserker
Basic.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, gain +3 Attack.
Basic.flavor: No Pain, No Gain.

Basic.name: Holy Nova
Basic.text: Deal $2 damage to all enemies. Restore #2 Health to all friendly characters.
Basic.flavor: If the Holy Light forsakes you, good luck casting this spell.  Also, you're probably a jerk.

Basic.name: Nightblade
Basic.flavor: Your face is the place you'd probably least like a dagger, and where rogues are most likely to deliver them.

Basic.name: Starving Buzzard
Basic.text: Whenever you summon a Beast, draw a card.
Basic.flavor: If you feed him, he loses his whole identity.

Basic.name: Stormpike Commando
Basic.flavor: The Stormpike Commandos are demolition experts.  They also bake a mean cupcake.

Basic.name: Tundra Rhino
Basic.flavor: Tundra rhinos are often mistaken for kodos.  Or am I mistaken?

Basic.name: Archmage
Basic.flavor: You earn the title of Archmage when you can destroy anyone who calls you on it.

Basic.name: Boulderfist Ogre
Basic.flavor: "ME HAVE GOOD STATS FOR THE COST"

Basic.name: Dread Infernal
Basic.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to ALL other characters.
Basic.flavor: "INFERNOOOOOOOOOO!" - Jaraxxus, Eredar Lord of the Burning Legion

Basic.name: Fire Elemental
Basic.flavor: He can never take a bath. Ewww.

Basic.name: Lord of the Arena
Basic.flavor: He used to be a 2100+ rated arena player, but that was years ago and nobody can get him to shut up about it.

Basic.name: Reckless Rocketeer
Basic.flavor: One Insane Rocketeer.   One Rocket full of Explosives.   Infinite Fun.

Basic.name: Starfire
Basic.flavor: Balance is important to druids.  This card is perfectly balanced.

Basic.name: Vanish
Basic.text: Return all minions to their owner's hand.

Basic.name: Core Hound
Basic.flavor: You don’t tame a Core Hound. You just train it to eat someone else before it eats you.

Basic.name: Flamestrike
Basic.text: Deal $4 damage to all enemy minions.
Basic.flavor: When the ground is on fire, you should not stop, drop, and roll.

Basic.name: Guardian of Kings
Basic.flavor: Holy beings from the beyond are so cliché!

Basic.name: Sprint
Basic.flavor: Rogues are not good joggers.

Basic.name: Stormwind Champion
Basic.flavor: When Deathwing assaulted the capital, this soldier was the only member of his squad to survive. Now he's all bitter and stuff.

Basic.name: War Golem
Basic.flavor: Golems are not afraid, but for some reason they still run when you cast Fear on them.  Instinct, maybe?  A desire to blend in?

Basic.name: Ironbark Protector
Basic.flavor: I dare you to attack Darnassus.

Basic.name: Mind Control
Basic.text: Take control of an enemy minion.
Basic.flavor: Nominated as "Spell Most Likely to Make Your Opponent Punch the Wall."

Give a minion +2/+2.
If it's a Beast, draw
a card.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Y'Shaarj had three sons: Mark, Theodore, and Chris.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Nat, the Darkfisher
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: At the start of your opponent's turn, they have a 50% chance to draw an extra card.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: You can take away his humanity, but you will never take away his fishing pole.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Renounce Darkness
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Replace your Hero Power and Warlock cards with another class's. The cards cost (1) less.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: SEE YA DARKNESS!

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Shatter
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Destroy a Frozen minion.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: What's cooler than being cool?

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Stormcrack
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Deal $4 damage to a minion. Overload: (1)
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: WARNING: DO NOT TOUCH THE PURPLE BALL OF LIGHTNING

Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Hero Power Summon a 1/1 Silver Hand Murloc.
Whispers of the Old Gods.name: The Tidal Hand
Twilight Geomancer
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: [x]Taunt Battlecry: Give your C'Thun Taunt (wherever it is).
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: "Ok C'Thun, repeat after me: 'Your mother was a hamster.'"

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Twisted Worgen
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Stealth
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Sometimes the Old Gods' corruptions gives you power untold, sometimes you get +1 Attack. We can’t all be winners in the Eldritch lottery.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Undercity Huckster
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Deathrattle: Add a random class card to your hand (from your opponent's class).
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Psst! Wanna buy a random class card (from your opponent's class)?

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Addled Grizzly
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: After you summon a minion, give it +1/+1.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Druids who spend too long in bear form are more susceptible to the whispers of the Old Gods.  Right now they are whispering the lyrics to "La Bamba".

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Am'gam Rager
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: peerc rewop

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Blood Warriors
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Add a copy of each damaged friendly minion to your hand.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: They have an uneasy rivalry with the Blood Paladins.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Bloodsail Cultist
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: If you control a Pirate, give your weapon +1/+1.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: They're really just in it for the Blood Parrot.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Carrion Grub
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Carrion, my wayward grub.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Darkshire Councilman
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: After you summon a minion, gain +1 Attack.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Democracy in action!

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Disciple of C'Thun
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage. Give your C'Thun +2/+2 (wherever it is).
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: C’Thun’s recruiting pitch involves cookies, which is why it’s the most popular Old God.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Feral Rage
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Choose One - Give your hero +4 Attack this turn; or Gain 8 Armor.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Let's be honest. One option is a lot ragier than the other.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Forlorn Stalker
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: Give all Deathrattle minions in your hand +1/+1.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: He's going to leave the dying up to you, if that's cool.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Infest
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Give your minions "Deathrattle: Add a random Beast to your hand."
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: The best part is the look on their face when you jump out of the cake! Err… corpse.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Rallying Blade
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: Give +1/+1 to your minions with Divine Shield.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: As far as blades go, this one is pretty great in the motivation department.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Ravaging Ghoul
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to all other minions.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: But goes by "Ravishing Ghoul" when he hits the club.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Shadow Strike
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Deal $5 damage to an undamaged character.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: It's like a backstab, only from the front. And with two more stabs.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Silithid Swarmer
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Can only attack if your hero attacked this turn.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: If your hero doesn't attack, it's just "Silithid Loner".

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Spawn of N'Zoth
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Deathrattle: Give your minions +1/+1.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Who's a cute widdle N'Zoth? You are! Yes you are! Yes you're the cutest widdle N'Zoth in the whole world!!!

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Spreading Madness
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Deal $9 damage randomly split among ALL characters.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Most citizens of Darkshire wear those surgical masks to prevent spreading Madness to tourists.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Squirming Tentacle
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Taunt
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Yeah, I think we can agree that killing the squirming tentacle first is a good idea.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Steward of Darkshire
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Whenever you summon a 1-Health minion, give it Divine Shield.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Turns out divine shields are way cheaper if you buy in bulk.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Twilight Elder
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: At the end of your turn, give your C'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Just doesn't understand those Twilight Youngsters any more - with their comic books and their rock music.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Twilight Flamecaller
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to all enemy minions.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Make sure you summon a Twilight Marshmallowcaller too! Mmmm Mmm Mmm!!

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Aberrant Berserker
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Enrage: +2 Attack.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: I berserk, therefore I am.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Blackwater Pirate
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Your weapons cost (2) less.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: "Look, they fell off the back of a ship, do you want them or not? I have a meeting with Y'Shaarj in like ten minutes."

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Bloodhoof Brave
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Taunt Enrage: +3 Attack.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: He thought the set was called "Flippers of the Old Cods" and hungrily volunteered to be in it.  He is definitely going to get his hearing checked.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: C'Thun's Chosen
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: [x]Divine Shield Battlecry: Give your C'Thun +2/+2 (wherever it is).
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: He gave her a promise ring and everything.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Cyclopian Horror
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Taunt. Battlecry: Gain +1 Health for each enemy minion.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: What are the qualifications for being a 'Horror?'  Just how horrible do you have to be?

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Demented Frostcaller
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: After you cast a spell, Freeze a random enemy.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: He prefers that you refer to him by his nickname: 'Frostwaker.'

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Eater of Secrets
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: Destroy all enemy Secrets. Gain +1/+1 for each.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: You don't want to be around after it has eaten an explosive trap.  You thought Sludge Belcher was bad...

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Evolved Kobold
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Spell Damage +2
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: You no take tentacle!

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Faceless Shambler
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Taunt Battlecry: Copy a friendly minion's Attack and Health.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: "What is that thing?!" "I'm not sure, but it seems to be sort of Y'sera shaped."

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Fandral Staghelm
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Your Choose One cards have both effects combined.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Always manages to mention "Back when I was creating the World Tree…" in EVERY conversation. Sheesh! Enough already.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Flamewreathed Faceless
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Overload: (2)
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: He's on fire! Boomshakalaka!

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Hooded Acolyte
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Whenever a character is healed, give your C'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Wait, what kind of acolyte doesn't wear a hood?

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Infested Tauren
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Taunt Deathrattle: Summon a 2/2 Slime.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: The Overmind and the Old Gods are surprisingly similar.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Infested Wolf
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Deathrattle: Summon two 1/1 Spiders.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: A little flea powder will fix that right up.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Klaxxi Amber-Weaver
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: If your C'Thun has at least 10 Attack, gain +5 Health.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Amberweaving is a specialty course at the local trade school.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Master of Evolution
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: Transform a friendly minion into a random one that costs (1) more.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Will be really useful in the new "Hearthémon" game.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Midnight Drake
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: Gain +1 Attack for each other card in your hand.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Still fearsome in the daytime.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Mire Keeper
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: [x]Choose One -Summon a 2/2 Slime; or Gain an empty Mana Crystal.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor:
"Hey.... Is that Mire for sale?" 
"No.  I'm keeping it."

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Polluted Hoarder
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Deathrattle: Draw a card.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Roll ‘greed’ OR THIS COULD HAPPEN TO YOU.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Shadow Word: Horror
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Destroy all minions with 2 or less Attack.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: It's more succinct than "Shadow Word: Suck Into Vortex."

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Shifting Shade
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Deathrattle: Copy a card from your opponent's deck and add it to your hand.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Yeah, it's cooler in the shade, but you're also more likely to get JACKED.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Southsea Squidface
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Deathrattle: Give your weapon +2 Attack.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Quick! Before I drown! Let me sharpen your sword for you.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Twilight Summoner
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 5/5 Faceless Destroyer.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: If you strike him down, he shall become more powerful than you can possibly imagine.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Xaril, Poisoned Mind
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry and Deathrattle: Add a random Toxin card to your hand.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: It's basically your own fault if you go around drinking weird green potions handed out by creepy mantid dudes.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Cabalist's Tome
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Add 3 random Mage spells to your hand.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: What's in there? I bet it's cookie recipes!

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Corrupted Healbot
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Deathrattle: Restore 8 Health to the enemy hero.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Not so much "corrupted" as "has terrible aim".

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Crazed Worshipper
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Taunt. Whenever this minion takes damage, give your C'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Every month they share a pancake breakfast with the Perfectly Rational Worshippers.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Cult Apothecary
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: For each enemy minion, restore 2 Health to your hero.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Cults need pharmacists too.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Darkshire Alchemist
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: Restore 5 Health.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: The secret ingredient: liquified funnel cake.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Darkspeaker
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: Swap stats with a friendly minion.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: People often think that Darkspeaker is the arch nemesis of Lightspeaker, but that title actually belongs to Heavyspeaker.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Hallazeal the Ascended
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Whenever your spells deal damage, restore that much Health to your hero.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Hallazeals all your dallazamage.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Hammer of Twilight
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 4/2 Elemental.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Stop! It's Twilight Hammer time.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Power Word: Tentacles
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Give a minion +2/+6.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Because you're wrapped in a protective layer of… tentacles?

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Princess Huhuran
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: Trigger a friendly minion's Deathrattle effect.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: She flitters around Ahn'Qiraj dreaming of the day she will meet a sweet prince, whom she can lay thousands of eggs with.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Psych-o-Tron
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Taunt Divine Shield
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: "Annoyinger-o-Tron" was just too unwieldy. And accurate.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Servant of Yogg-Saron
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: Cast a random spell that costs (5) or less (targets chosen randomly).
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Yogg-Saron always likes to complain about how he has too many servants and there are too many mouths to feed.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Shadowcaster
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: Choose a friendly minion. Add a 1/1 copy to your hand that costs (1).
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: I mean, it's not creepy if you ASK before you steal their shadow to make a small replica of them to keep on your shelf.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Stand Against Darkness
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Summon five 1/1 Silver Hand Recruits.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Or if you're too tired, you can just kind of lean against the darkness.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Tentacles for Arms
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Deathrattle: Return this to your hand.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: That's right. Garrosh just slapped you to death with a tentacle.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Twilight Darkmender
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: If your C'Thun has at least 10 Attack, restore 10 Health to your hero.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: First she separates them from the lights, washes them in cold water, and hang-dries.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Usher of Souls
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Whenever a friendly minion dies, give your C'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Nothing unburdens your soul like a good ushing!

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Validated Doomsayer
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: At the start of your turn, set this minion's Attack to 7.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Really feels good about himself and is in a much better place now. But… he sure does miss piloting those shredders.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Ancient Harbinger
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: At the start of your turn, put a 10-Cost minion from your deck into your hand.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: "honey, can u run down to the store and pick up some 10 cost minions? thx"

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Corrupted Seer
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage to all non-Murloc minions.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: For seers, it's very handy to have your crystal ball hanging right in front of your face.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Dark Arakkoa
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: [x]Taunt Battlecry: Give your C'Thun +3/+3 (wherever it is).
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: There's a whole gradient of Arakkoa! This one is on the darker side.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Faceless Summoner
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: Summon a random 3-Cost minion.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: They never get the recognition they deserve.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Herald Volazj
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: Summon a 1/1 copy of each of your other minions.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: His whole job is yelling "Yogg-Saron comin'!"

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Mukla, Tyrant of the Vale
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: Add 2 Bananas to your hand.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Pro tip: DO NOT BOGART THE BANANAS.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Nerubian Prophet
Whispers of the Old Gods.text:
At the start of your turn, reduce this card's
Cost by (1).
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: It’s a self-reducing prophecy.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Scaled Nightmare
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: At the start of your turn, double this minion's Attack.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: I like it because it scales.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Skeram Cultist
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: Give your C'Thun +2/+2 (wherever it is).
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Just before he comes into play, there is an AWESOME training montage with C'Thun.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Thing from Below
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: [x]Taunt Costs (1) less for each Totem you've summoned this game.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Just can't resist the opportunity to hang around with a bunch of totems.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Thistle Tea
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Draw a card. Add 2 extra copies of it to your hand.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Aren't Thistles prickly?  Why would you drink them? I don't get Rogues.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Ancient Shieldbearer
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: If your C'Thun has at least 10 Attack, gain 10 Armor.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Back in her day, each shield weighed two tons and she had to carry four of them on each arm!

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Bog Creeper
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Taunt
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: He's tried other things, but bog sidling, bog ambling, and bog trundling just aren't as effective as bog creeping.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Cho'gall
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: The next spell you cast this turn costs Health instead of Mana.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Even after all this time, Gul'dan still makes Cho'gall go get donuts and coffee.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Grotesque Dragonhawk
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Windfury
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: They say that "grotesque is in the eye of the beholder," but that's just because they've never seen a Grotesque Dragonhawk. Yikes!

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Hogger, Doom of Elwynn
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, summon a 2/2 Gnoll with Taunt.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: When C'thun went to sleep, he checked under his bed for Hogger.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Malkorok
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: Equip a random weapon.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Garrosh's best buddy. It's true. Look it up.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Twin Emperor Vek'lor
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: [x]Taunt Battlecry: If your C'Thun has at least 10 Attack, summon another Emperor.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Do they make decisions based on age? "I'm two minutes older therefore we burn this village."

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Twin Emperor Vek'nilash
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Taunt

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Wisps of the Old Gods
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Choose One - Summon seven 1/1 Wisps; or Give your minions +2/+2.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: They're just normal wisps, actually. The "Of the Old Gods" bit is just marketing.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Anomalus
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Deathrattle: Deal 8 damage to all minions.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: That's short for "Anomnomnomnomalus".

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Call of the Wild
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Summon all three Animal Companions.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: "Hello. Misha, Leokk and Huffer aren't here right now, but if you leave a message we'll get back to you right away." BEEP.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Doomcaller
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: Give your C'Thun +2/+2 (wherever it is). If it's dead, shuffle it into your deck.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: "Hello, is Doom there? No? Can I leave a message?"

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Eldritch Horror
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Often wonders what path his life might have taken if he wasn't named, you know, "Eldritch Horror".

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Giant Sand Worm
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Whenever this attacks and kills a minion, it may attack again.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Banned from every all-you-can-eat buffet on Azeroth.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Ragnaros, Lightlord
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: At the end of your turn, restore 8 Health to a damaged friendly character.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: What happens when you try and corrupt a corrupted firelord? DOUBLE NEGATIVE, INSECT!

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: The Boogeymonster
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Whenever this attacks and kills a minion, gain +2/+2.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Has 20 years of training in classical ballet, but ALLLLLL he ever gets asked to do is boogie.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Blade of C'Thun
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: Destroy a minion. Add its Attack and Health to_your C'Thun's (wherever it is).
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: C'Thun demands a sacrifice! Preferably a Deathwing.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Blood of The Ancient One
Whispers of the Old Gods.text:
If you control two of these
at the end of your turn, merge them into 'The Ancient One'.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Add two cups of Blood of the Ancient One to one cup of lemon juice. Add just a dash of sugar and stir. Delicious!

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Soggoth the Slitherer
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Taunt Can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Don't tell Soggoth, but in the future he gets totally owned by the Master's Glaive and his skull becomes a tourist attraction.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: C'Thun
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: Deal damage equal to this minion's Attack randomly split among all enemies.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: C'Thun
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: Deal damage equal to this minion's Attack randomly split among all enemies.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: C'Thun's least favorite Hearthstone card: Eye for an Eye.
Whispers of the Old Gods.howToGet: Unlocked when opening a Whispers of the Old Gods pack.
Whispers of the Old Gods.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked after opening a Whispers of the Old Gods pack.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Deathwing, Dragonlord
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Deathrattle: Put all Dragons from your hand into the battlefield.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: To his credit, Deathwing really took to heart the feedback he was receiving that he needed to be "more of a team player".

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: DOOM!
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Destroy all minions. Draw a card for each.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: We ran out of space for "DOOOOOOOOOOOM!!!!!"

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Faceless Behemoth
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Rejected names: Forty-Foot Faceless, Big ol' No-face, Huge Creature Sans Face, Teddy.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: N'Zoth, the Corruptor
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: Summon your Deathrattle minions that died this game.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Has not been able to get "Under the Sea" out of his head for like FIVE THOUSAND YEARS.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Y'Shaarj, Rage Unbound
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: At the end of your turn, put a minion from your deck into the battlefield.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: When he's working out, he binds all that rage back into a ponytail.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Yogg-Saron, Hope's End
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: Cast a random spell for each spell you've cast this game (targets chosen randomly).
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: I spell your doom... Y-O-U-R D-O-O-M!
